feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataform
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataform

entry.content: Dataform workflows, BigQuery notebooks, pipelines, and data preparations are enforcing strict act-as mode at the project level. To avoid failures and maintain automatic releases, you must use custom service accounts instead of the default Dataform service agent across all repositories. You must also grant the Service Account User role (roles/iam.serviceAccountUser) to the default Dataform service agent and relevant principals. For more information and to verify act-as permissions, see Use strict act-as mode.
entry.summary: Dataform and BigQuery are enforcing strict act-as mode at the project level. To prevent service disruptions, you must update your configurations to use custom service accounts and grant specific IAM roles. Please refer to the documentation for detailed instructions.
entry.title: Breaking: Important changes to Dataform and BigQuery

entry.content: Strict act-as mode for Dataform is now generally available (GA). This feature enhances security by requiring users to have the iam.serviceAccounts.actAs permission on the service account used to run workflows, ensuring a more secure and predictable permissions model for your Dataform projects.
entry.summary: Dataform's Strict Act-As mode is now generally available, enhancing security by requiring explicit `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permissions for workflow execution. This ensures a more secure and predictable permissions model for your Dataform projects.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform Strict Act-As Mode Now GA

entry.content: You can verify and resolve iam.serviceAccounts.actAs permission issues in Dataform by checking Cloud Logging, interpreting log entries, and granting the necessary IAM roles. For more information, see Verify act-as permissions for the effective service account. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: New tooling in Dataform helps you identify and fix `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission problems. You can now check Cloud Logging to diagnose these issues and grant the appropriate IAM roles to resolve them. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Resolve service account permission issues in Dataform

entry.content: Dataform offers enhanced IAM permissions, providing more granular control over resource creation and scheduling. Administrators can also enable private workspaces to restrict access to the workspace creator. These features are in preview.
entry.summary: Dataform now provides more granular IAM permissions for resource creation and scheduling. Administrators can also enable private workspaces for restricted access. These new capabilities are currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform enhances access control

entry.content: Dataform now lets you automate the creation of BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataform now supports the automation of BigLake table creation for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform Now Supports BigLake Tables for Apache Iceberg

entry.content: You can use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more granular control over specific fields for the CompilationResult, ReleaseConfig, WorkflowConfig, WorkflowInvocation, and Workspace resources. For more information, see Create custom organization policy constraints. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Organization policy now supports custom constraints for granular control over specific fields in CompilationResult, ReleaseConfig, WorkflowConfig, WorkflowInvocation, and Workspace resources.
entry.title: Feature: Custom constraints for Dataform resources

entry.content: You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more granular control over specific fields for some Dataform resources. For more information, see Create custom organization policy constraints. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Organization Policy now supports custom constraints for Dataform, offering finer control over specific fields. This generally available feature allows for more granular management of Dataform resources.
entry.title: Feature: New controls for Dataform resources

entry.content: You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs in Dataform to run queries as interactive jobs that start running as quickly as possible or as batch jobs with lower priority. For more information, see Create a workflow configuration and InvocationConfig. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs in Dataform to run queries as interactive jobs that start running as quickly as possible or as batch jobs with lower priority.
entry.title: Feature: Set BigQuery job priority in Dataform

entry.content: You can now update an incremental table schema without a full table refresh. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now update an incremental table schema without a full table refresh. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Schema Updates Without Full Refresh

entry.content: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries. This makes setting the default location optional in your workflow configurations. For more information, see About repository settings. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries, making the default location optional in your workflow configurations. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform automatically selects processing location

entry.content: A security vulnerability was discovered in the Dataform API. This vulnerability could potentially allow unauthorized access to customer code repositories and data. For more information, see GCP-2025-045 security bulletin.
entry.title: Security: Dataform API Vulnerability

entry.content: Updates to the automatic cataloging of Dataform metadata in Dataplex improve the near real-time management and search capabilities for repository metadata. These features are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataplex now offers improved near real-time management and search for Dataform repository metadata, with features now generally available. This update enhances how users interact with and find information within their data catalogs.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform Metadata Management in Dataplex Updated

entry.content: Dark theme is now available for BigQuery and Dataform. To turn on the dark theme, go to the Console, open the Settings and utilities menu next to your avatar, and select Preferences. On the User preferences page, select Appearance in the navigation, select your color theme, and save your selection.
entry.summary: You can now enable dark theme for BigQuery and Dataform. Access this feature through the User Preferences page under Appearance settings in the Console.
entry.title: Announcement: Dark Theme Now Available for BigQuery and Dataform

entry.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines, the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations, and the creation of workflow configurations. For more information, see Schedule runs. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now use your Google Account credentials to authorize pipeline creation, scheduling, and execution, as well as notebook scheduling and data preparation. Workflow configurations can also be created using these credentials. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Use Google Account Credentials for Authorization

entry.content: You can now use strict act-as mode to enable an additional security check for certain user actions in Dataform. For more information, see Use strict act-as mode. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Dataform now supports strict act-as mode, an enhanced security feature for user actions. This preview feature adds an extra layer of verification for specific operations.
entry.title: Feature: New security feature in Dataform
